meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a sudden, sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: I will zap the ball with my foot.
meanings.sent2: The superhero zapped the villain with lightning.
meanings.sent3: Watch out! I might accidentally zap you with this rubber band.
meanings.sent4: Her words zapped his heart like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent5: The sudden zap of the door slamming made me jump.

meanings.definition: To destroy or kill with a sudden burst of energy.
meanings.sent1: The laser beam can zap the enemy's spaceship.
meanings.sent2: The bug zapper can zap mosquitoes effectively.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally zapped my computer with static electricity.
meanings.sent4: The powerful spell zapped the evil sorcerer out of existence.
meanings.sent5: The lightning zap obliterated the old tree in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The rabbit will zap across the field in a flash.
meanings.sent2: The car zapped past us on the highway.
meanings.sent3: I need to zap to the store before it closes.
meanings.sent4: The idea zapped into her mind out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship zapped through the galaxy at incredible speed.

meanings.definition: A sudden burst of energy or power.
meanings.sent1: The zap of lightning lit up the sky.
meanings.sent2: The machine gave a powerful zap when turned on.
meanings.sent3: The zap of caffeine helped me stay awake during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a zap of enthusiasm that inspired the audience.
meanings.sent5: The zap of electricity surged through the wires.
